__e: You've been the golden boy here for the past three years while I've cried in closets, hid from Dr Cox, and relied on you every day to get me through it.
I must've cried for two weeks straight.
I've been up here 20 minutes crying' my eyes out, and none of you bastards would come up and tell me what happened!
Good. How do you think I got this gray hair?
When I was your age, why, I didn't care much for what men in gray hair did or what they had to say.
"Life is short." "Oh, here, the gray hairs are coming in."
Probably been crying, expecting the worst.
I was sick and tired of everything
I have known many like you, men who, once their hairs bleed grey and their spines cut them like daggers, come to revise their own history.
